page.title: 06WALTHAMS CROSS
page.content: Walthams Cross is a very old village it is about 7OO years old. On the 24th June we went to see Mrs.Turner who told us about Walthams Cross.Her house is about 6OO years old and the beams still show the knots in the wood. There are very few new houses there by helping the village to retain its original character. Mrs. Turner has lived in the village for 35 years.When she first moved there, there was a chapel which has since been knocked down. Many of the cottages, which are now only one dwelling, were once divided into two or three with families of ten and twelve living in each of them. Mrs. Turner moved to her cottage because it was available at the time. She was born in Great Bardfield and married a man from Finchingfield.
